critical_questions.text: Is the cited expert credible and competent?
Is the expert's domain the right one for the claim?
Do other qualified experts broadly agree?
Is the expert view consistent with the evidence?
Will the action actually achieve the goal?
Is there a better available alternative?
Are the side effects acceptable?
Does the action conflict with other important goals?
Do preconditions for the action hold?
How probable are the cited consequences?
How serious/valuable are the consequences?
Are there countervailing consequences that outweigh them?
What value trade-offs affect the recommendation?
How strong/regular is the causal link?
Are there intervening factors that block the effect?
Are there alternative causes?
Is the causal claim testable and well-supported?
How reliable is the sign for the hypothesis?
Are there plausible alternative explanations?
What are the relevant base rates?
Is the observation measured/observed accurately?
Are the similarities relevant to the transferred property?
Are there important disanalogies?
Are the source/target typical?
Is the similarity robust and comprehensive?
Is the sample large enough?
Is the sample representative?
Are there selection/measurement biases?
Are there known exceptions/defeaters?
Does the source have reliable access to the information?
Is the source generally reliable/truthful?
Does the source have conflicts of interest?
Is there independent corroboration?
Have plausible confounders been controlled for?
Is there a plausible mechanism?
Does X precede Y (no reverse causation)?
Is the correlation robust across datasets/methods?
Do the facts match the rule conditions?
Are there applicable exceptions to the rule?
Does this rule conflict with a higher-priority rule?
Is the definition adequate and accepted?
Do the case facts actually fit the definition?
Are there borderline cases or vagueness to address?
